greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let f be the completely multiplicative function over the positive rational numbers defined by f(p) = A034386(p) for any prime number p; f constitutes a permutation of the positive rational numbers; let g be the inverse of f; for any n > 0, a(n) is the denominator of g(n).
comment: See A319626 for the corresponding numerators and additional comments.
link: Daniel Suteu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = 1 iff n belongs to A025487.
mathematica: Array[#2/GCD[#1, #2] & @@ {#, Apply[Times, Map[If[#1 <= 2, 1, NextPrime[#1, -1]]^#2 & @@ # &, FactorInteger[#]]]} &, 120] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Aug 27 2020 *)
results.author: _Rémy Sigrist_, Sep 25 2018
